content: this is a summary of a legal text regarding a cassation case that took place on march 31st 2017 the text discusses a divorce case involving joint property compensation the courts determined that the defendant received gifts and used a portion of it for the family home the plaintiff failed to timely object to the assessment by the notary the courts upheld the compensation calculation based on the auction value of the home which goes against the civil code the judgment annuls the ruling and refers the case back to the court of appeal for reconsideration of costs the legal principles used in the decision include articles from the civil code and the judicial code the compensation in a divorce case is determined based on the value of the property at the time of dissolution the value in 2008 must be followed even if the property is sold years later the procedure involved an appeal to the brussels court of appeal which led to the cassation appeal the first ground of appeal argues violations of various legal articles and general principles of law the second ground of appeal questions the admissibility of the defendants claim the courts decision sets aside the judgment and refers the case back to the court of appeal for reconsideration the facts of the case involve a marriage and subsequent divorce with the liquidation and division of the matrimonial property regime ordered the first ground of appeal focuses on the violations of law in the appellate courts decision regarding the amount of compensation and the contributions of the parties the second ground of appeal questions the admissibility of the defendants claim the court found that before the marriage the respondent received gifts totaling eur 19365253 and after the marriage eur 9915741 was received the defendant filed documents showing an inventory of the estate which stated that the claimant received gifts totaling eur 340000 the court determined that in order for the gifts to belong to the matrimonial community it must be explicitly stated by the donors the document explains that the parties involved in the case are disputing the division of assets and compensation the document argues that the appellate courts violated certain articles of the civil code and judicial code in their decision the document concludes by requesting that the decision be set aside and the case be referred to another court
